Or, as per our contributor, you can go out the front drive, take a left on the street, and then another quick left down a side road. The Coyote Creek Trail is a mostly paved trail. As per our contributor, "You can go south on the trail 5 miles to the beginning trail head at the Anderson Lake County Park with lots of parking and a nice visitor center, If you head north its another 21 miles of great path. Lots of tree shade and beautiful parks - the flowering bushes!!!! The trail crosses the little river/creek a few times.

As per our contributor: From the campground's front driveway you can access the Omer Rains Trail/Ventura River Trail and the Ojai Valley Trail. Left out of the driveway, you are on the Omer Rains beach path which ends at the Emma Woods Park, but really goes on forever because you can continue to ride up Hwy 1 on a decent bike path on both sides of the road. Right out of the RV Park, you can pick up the Ventura River Trail which is wonderful. Its about 5.5 miles, but it runs seamlessly into the Ojai Valley Trail which is another 9.3 miles.
entries.contributor: Thank you to Barb from Cottonwood, Arizona for emailing in this location!

First, you can exit the neighborhood and turn left, heading up Revett Dr. At the end of the road, turn right onto Tiger Rd, which will lead you to the intersection of Hwy 9 and Tiger Rd, where you'll find a traffic light and crosswalk. Alternatively, you can exit the neighborhood and turn right. Just past the dirt parking lot, you’ll see a path that takes you through the field and under the bridge, providing direct access to the rec path.

You could ride west from the Welcome Center about 6 miles to Loma which is the western end of the trail or ride east about 15 miles to the eastern end of the trail. From there, it goes to an underpass and directly to the trail. From that point, you could head up the river for about 3 miles to the trails end, or you can head north for about 9 miles, past Arches and through the Moab scenery all the way up to Seven Mile RV and about 2-3 miles past that.

You will see a small one way bridge-go over and you can go either north or south on the Jordan River Parkway Trail. This is a 45 mile trail. The South 12 miles is amazing(of course it goes many more miles) -directly on the water. Lots to look at..Parley's Trail is a direct shoot off from this trail. The North is about 5-6 miles to the end but it flows seamlessly into the Legacy Parkway Trail.
entries.contributor: Thank you to Barb from Cottonwood, Arizona for emailing in this location!

This city park is a 0.4 mile bike ride on a quiet street to the Pere Marquette Trail. The Pere Marquette Trail intersects the White Pine trail in less than a half of a mile. The Pere Marquette Trail is a 30 mile paved trail. The White Pine Trail State Park is a 92 mile linear trail, most of which is asphalt.
Near the park's entrance is a connecting trail to the Huron Sunrise Trail. This is an 11 mile paved trail which runs along Lake Huron shoreline.

trail.name: Van Buren State Park Spur Trail

entries.trail_notes: The campground has direct access to the Van Buren State Park Spur Trail which is a 5.5 mile paved trail which goes to South Haven. Riders can access the Van Buren State Park Trail which is an additional 12 miles of gravel surface. The Kal-Have State Park Trail connects in South Haven and provides an additional 33.5 miles of trail. Kal-Haven State Park Trail is an abandoned railway bed and is made of crushed limestone/slay.
The 10.5 mile paved TART trail runs alongside the park. The Leelanau Trail provides an additional 17 miles of paved trails to ride.
The campground has direct access to the Heartland Trail. This is a 49 mile multi-use trail. Much of the trail is paved.
The paved trail within the park connects to the Paul Bunyan State Trail which is 115 miles long.
The park's trail is part of the southern section of the Paul Bunyan State Trail which is 115 miles long.
The campground has easy access to the Willard Munger State Trail. This is a 70 mile paved trail.

campground.name: Rice Creek Chain of Lakes Campground

entries.trail_notes: The campground has easy access to the Central Anoka County Regional Trail. This is a work in progress, but at this time the trail is paved for 16 miles. There are regional trails in the area.
The campground has access to the Duluth Lakewalk. This is an 8 mile paved trail.
The campground is adjacent to the East Gull Lake Trail. This trail is an 8.5 mile paved trail.
There is a 5.5 mile paved trail which goes from the campground to the beach on Lake Clayton.
entries.contributor: Thanks to John W. for emailing in this campground/trail location!

entries.trail_notes: The Root River Trail is a 42 mile paved trail on an abandoned railroad bed. This is a 42 mile paved trail on an abandoned railroad bed.
There is about 6 miles of paved trail within the park which has connections to another paved trail which is 3 miles and goes into Luverne. The total riding is about 15 miles.

There is a six mile paved trail within the park which connects Douglas Lodge to the Mississippi River headwaters. Cyclists can also ride an additional ten miles on the Wilderness Loop Drive; however, it is shared with automobiles.

campground.name: Lake Vermilion-Sudan Underground Mine State Park

entries.trail_notes: The Mesabi Trail runs through the state park. This is a 150 mile paved trail.

entries.cg_notes: State Park. Glacial Lakes State Park
entries.trail_notes: Take the campground road to the park's entrance. There you can get on the Glacial Ridge Bike Trail. This is a 5 mile paved trail which goes to the town of Starbuck.
entries.contributor: Thanks to John W. for emailing in this campground/trail location!

entries.trail_notes: The Gitchi-Gami State Trail goes through the state park. When completed, this will be an 86 mile paved trail. There are currently several sections completed, totaling 33 miles.

trail.name: Sakatah Singing Hills State Park Trail

entries.trail_notes: The campground has access to the Sakatah Singing Hills State Park Trail. This is a 39 mile paved trail.
There are about seven miles of paved trails in Winona which can be accessed from the campground.

entries.cg_notes: Conservation. Mississippi Land Conservation Assistance Network. Call for information: 601 792 8225
entries.trail_notes: The Longleaf Trace Trail is a 44 mile paved linear trail. This is a 44 mile paved linear trail.
There is a 3.9 paved bicycle trail around the lake in the state park.
There is a 12.5 mile paved trail in the state park.

The campground is located 0.7 mile from the Katy Trail. The 0.7 mile is on the Sacajawea Road which is a small country road. The Katy Trail is a 240 mile, crushed limestone surface trail, across Missouri.

campground.name: Camp Branch or Crow's Creek at Lake Smithville

entries.trail_notes: There are 37 miles of 10 foot wide paved asphalt trail with the park system. There are 37 miles of 10 foot wide paved asphalt trail.

There is a paved 2.8 mile bicycle trail within the park. Also available is the Weston Bluffs Trail which is a 3.1 mile trail which goes into the town of Weston. Weston Bluffs trail is a combination of asphalt and fined crushed gravel surfaces.

entries.cg_notes: County Park. This campground has 19 RV sites which are on a first-come, first-served basis. The camping season is April 12 to October 13. The gates are open at 7:30 a.m. until 8:00 p.m
entries.trail_notes: The campground is on the 4.5 mile Riverway Trail. This trail does connect to the St. Joe Trail and the South Locust Street Trail.

entries.cg_notes: State Recreation Area. Fort Kearny State Recreation Area. East and West Campgrounds
entries.trail_notes: The Fort Kearny Hike-Bike Trail begins at the campground. This is a paved trail. It goes for 1.8 miles to Bassway Strip Wildlife Management Area and then for another 13.2 miles to Cottonmill Park in Kearney.
entries.contributor: Thanks to my friend and fellow blogger, Julia T. for emailing in this location!

entries.trail_notes: The Cowboy Trail is a 187 mile Rail-to-Trail of crushed limestone.
There is a paved 3.1 mile trail around the lake. In addition, there are connecting trails to other city trails.
The Quaker multi-use trail is 7.8 miles and runs from Quaker Beach to Stony Cabin Trail. The Quaker multi-use trail can be accessed from the campground.

entries.cg_notes: State Park. Allegany State Park Rte 1
entries.trail_notes: There is a 5.5 mile paved multi-use trail which can be accessed from the A section of the campground.

entries.cg_notes: RV Park. This park does offer a weekly pump out service
entries.trail_notes: The campground is located one-half mile from the North Coast Inland Trail. This is a 28 mile multi-use trail with crushed limestone and asphalt surfaces. To get to the trail from the campground, cross US 20, go several yards to Sand Hill Road. Take Sand Hill Road to the trail entrance. US 20 is a divided road with good visibility.
entries.contributor: Thanks to Julia from Alabama for sending in this location!

entries.trail_notes: There is a 5 mile paved bike path in the park which connects to the City of Oregon Bike Trail.
The state park connects to the Buck Creek Trail. This is a paved 6 mile trail which does connect to other trails.
The campground is adjacent to the Metro Parks' Bike & Hike Trail. This is a 34 mile rail trail.
The campground has access to the Little Miami Scenic Trail and the Creekside Trail. The Little Miami Scenic Trail is a paved 78 mile trail. The Creekside Trail is a 15 mile paved trail.

campground.name: Viento State Park. Mt. Hood National Forest

entries.cg_notes: National Forest. Mt. Hood National Forest

trail.name: Historic Columbia River Highway State Trail

entries.trail_notes: The campground has access to a 5.6 mile paved section of the Historic Columbia River Highway State Trail.
There is a 1.8 mile paved trail which goes through the forest and provides a view of the bay.
There are about 6 miles of bike trails within the park.
The Pine Creek Rail Trail has a hard packed gravel surface and is 62 miles long.
The Great Allegheny Passage is a 150 mile trail.
The Great Allegheny Passage is a 150 mile trail with 27 miles in Ohiopyle State Park.

The campground has a bike path to bay front attractions and to Presque Isle State Park. It is about 6.7 miles to the state park. Once at the state park, the trail continues for about another six miles. The campground is also near the Bayfront Bikeway.
There is a 6.2 mile paved trail which runs right by the campground. Additionally, there are several smaller trails within the state park.
The Creekside Trail runs from the Grace Coolidge campground to the park's main Visitor Center which is across the street from Game Lodge campground. The trail is about 2 miles (one way) and is paved.
The Creekside Trail runs from the Grace Coolidge campground to the park's main Visitor Center which is across the street from Game Lodge campground. The trail is about 2 miles (one way) and is paved.

entries.cg_notes: State Park. South Dakota State Park
entries.trail_notes: There is a 7.9 mile paved trail which runs through Lewis & Clark State Recreation Area, Pierson Ranch Recreation Area and ends at Chief White Crane Recreation Area. On the west side of Pierson Ranch Recreation Area, there is a 4.5 paved trail which takes you into Yankton.

entries.cg_notes: Army Corps of Engineers. This campground is located near Crofton, NE
entries.trail_notes: There is a paved trail which runs from Yankton to the Gavins Point Area. There is also a multi-use trail in the Gavins Point area.

entries.cg_notes: State Park. South Dakota State Park
entries.trail_notes: There is a 7.9 mile paved trail which runs through Lewis & Clark State Recreation Area, Pierson Ranch Recreation Area and ends at Chief White Crane Recreation Area. On the west side of Pierson Ranch Recreation Area, there is a 4.5 paved trail which takes you into Yankton.

entries.cg_notes: State Park. South Dakota State Park
entries.trail_notes: There is a 7.9 mile paved trail which runs through Lewis & Clark State Recreation Area, Pierson Ranch Recreation Area and ends at Chief White Crane Recreation Area. On the west side of Pierson Ranch Recreation Area, there is a 4.5 paved trail which takes you into Yankton.

entries.cg_notes: Army Corps of Engineers. Cheatham Lake
entries.trail_notes: The Cumberland River Bicentennial Trail ends at Lock A's day use area. This is a 6.7 mile paved and compacted gravel trail. The first section of the trail starting from the Lock A area is rocky and may be difficult for road bikes.
There is a 3 mile paved trail within the park.

entries.cg_notes: National Forest. Cherokee National Forest. Trailers and RVs are limited to 26 feet. Call the campground for more information: (423) 253-8400
entries.trail_notes: There is a 3.2 mile dirt trail which loops around the lake. This is a very popular campground and is in a beautiful area.

trail.name: seven miles of paved biking trails

entries.trail_notes: There are seven miles of paved biking trails which connect all the major areas of the park. There are also mountain biking trails in the park.
This trail contains a very steep hill. See the related Blog Post for more info. From the campground, ride the road over the dam to the trail.
The Trailway is a 20 mile reclaimed railroad bed which runs through the park.
There are miles of trails within the park. The trails are mostly flat, and the surface is dirt and gravel.
entries.contributor: Thanks to my friend and fellow blogger, Julia T. for emailing in this location.

entries.trail_notes: The Cross Timbers Trail is a 3.9 mile paved path.

entries.cg_notes: RV Park. Dry and Electric only. Staying 2 or more days grants access to water and dump stations
entries.trail_notes: The Moab Canyon Pathway is located at the entrance to the RV park. This is a 13 mile paved trail. Barb from Cottonwood, Arizona reports that from the RV Park entrance, you can do the 12.7 mile ride south to Moab. Then the trail turns and goes up the river. At the intersection where the trail heads up the river you can hop on the sidewalks and be directly in the town of Moab.
entries.contributor: Thanks to Barb from Cottonwood, Arizona for emailing in this location!

entries.cg_notes: State Park. Utah Lake State Park
entries.trail_notes: The campground is 0.25 mile from the Provo River Parkway Trail. This is a paved, multi-use 15 mile trail.
entries.contributor: Thanks to Barb from Cottonwood, Arizona for emailing in this location!

entries.trail_notes: The Newport Recreation Path runs right through the campground. This is a 7 mile rail trail which is crushed stone and paved. The trail runs connects with the Beebe Spur which goes into Canada, so passports would be needed.
The Willapa Hill State Park runs through Rainbow Falls State Park. This is a 56 mile trail with its surface being some asphalt and some compacted gravel.

The campground is about one mile from the Palouse to Cascades State Trail. To reach the trail, ride on from the campground road to Watson Cutoff Road to the trail. The Palouse to Cascades State Trail is a 250 mile trail with varying surfaces. The state is working to improve the surface of the trail.

entries.cg_notes: State Park. Nine Mile Recreation Area
entries.trail_notes: The Spokane River Centennial Trail goes through the park. This is a 40 mile paved trail
The North Bend Rail Trail is a 72 mile crushed limestone trail.
entries.contributor: Thanks to Tony C. from Detroit, Michigan for emailing in this location!

entries.trail_notes: The Greenbrier River Trail can be accessed from the campground by riding on the road to the campground for about one and a half miles to Seebert. The Greenbrier River Trail is a 78 mile rail trail.
The campground is adjacent to the Military Ridge State Trail. This is a 40 mile trail, mostly of crushed stone but with a small section of asphalt.

entries.cg_notes: State Park. North Campground is dry camping. South Campground has partial hookups
entries.trail_notes: There is a one mile hike/bike connector trail from the state park's entrance to the Old Abe State Trail which is a 20 mile paved trail.

entries.cg_notes: State Park. There are 5 campgrounds in the park offering dry camping and sites with electrical hook ups
entries.trail_notes: The Sunset Trail is 9.6 miles of fine gravel. The park also offers 12 miles of off road biking.

campground.name: William G. Lunney Lake Farm County Park

entries.cg_notes: County Park. This park is part of Capital Springs Recreation Area. Electrical Hook ups
entries.trail_notes: This campground has two paved trails going through the park. Capital City State Trail is a 20 mile paved trail. The Lower Yahara River Trail is a 2.5 off road connection between Madison and McFarland.
The park's campground has direct access to the Great River State Trail. This is a 24 mile trail with a surface of crushed limestone.
The Rawley Point Bicycle Trail starts at the lodge parking lot and goes for 5 miles. The trail is a hard packed limestone base. The trail then connects to Mariners Trail - a 7 mile paved trail.
The Elroy-Sparta Bicycle Trail is a 32 mile trail. The surface is crushed limestone.

entries.cg_notes: National Preserve. Big Cypress National Preserve
entries.trail_notes: There are 21 miles of trails (which are hard packed dirt and gravel) that can be accessed from the Bear Island campground. These are old oil well roads, and cars are not allowed. These trails can also be accessed for day use. See the Related Blog Post.
entries.blog_post: Biking in Big Cypress and Beyond.

entries.cg_notes: National Park. Great Smoky Mountain National Park
entries.trail_notes: Many folks know the 11 mile Cades Cove loop in the Great Smoky Mountains National Park is closed to vehicular traffic on Wednesdays, thus allowing folks to bike this scenic trail. The Cades Cove campground is located near the entrance to the 11 mile loop. Just be aware, the closure to vehicular traffic is only May through September with the specific dates set each year. For more info, check out the Cades Cove Great Smoky Mountains National Park website.

entries.cg_notes: BLM. Goose Island Campground is located right on the Goose Island Trail which connects to the Moab Canyon Pathway. There are two group sites which can be reserved. In addition, there are 20 campsites which are on a first-come, first-served basis. For more info, check out the Campground BLM site or call (435) 259-2100
entries.trail_notes: The Goose Island Trail connects to the Moab Canyon Pathway. The Moab Canyon Pathway is a 13 mile paved trail.
entries.contributor: Thanks to Barb from Cottonwood, Arizona for emailing in this location!

entries.trail_notes: The state park is located across the street from the Lincoln Boyhood National Memorial. Both the state park and the National Memorial have lots of activities and things to do. We rode our bikes ten miles in the state park, and we rode our bikes to the National Memorial which is across the street.

The campground is located very near the Greenbrier entrance of Great Smoky Mountains National Park. One can ride the back roads from the campground to the Greenbrier entrance and then on the park road for a total ride of about eleven miles.

entries.cg_notes: This is a 55+ RV resort which offers full hook ups for short term or seasonal stays. The resort also offers organized bike rides.
entries.trail_notes: The campground is adjacent to the Tucson Loop. The Tucson Loop is a 131 mile trail with an asphalt surface.
entries.contributor: Thanks to Ken and Martha Wiseman for this suggestion!
